items.title: Live: Email to former prince Andrew among millions of new 'Epstein files' documents
items.description: More than 2,000 videos and 180,000 images have been released as part of the batch, which comes weeks after a legally mandated deadline signed by Donald Trump. Follow live.

items.title: What we know about the suspected murder-suicide of a Perth family of four
items.description: An entire family has been found dead in their own home — a mother, a father and their two teenage boys, with police describing the event as "highly distressing" and a "devastating tragedy".

items.title: Taylor picked as Liberal right's leading man as stalking of Ley begins
items.description: One Liberal source told the ABC a challenge to Sussan Ley's leadership is now a "matter of when, not if".

items.title: Trump's foreign policy bluffs undermine each other
items.description: As the US president faces domestic consequences for his violent immigration crackdown, his geopolitical bluffs across the world also come at a price.

items.title: Djokovic hits out at critics after epic Australian Open win over Sinner
items.description: After beating two-time defending Jannik Sinner in five gruelling sets, Novak Djokovic sets his sights on those who doubted whether he could still be an Australian Open contender.

items.title: 'Less light in my world': Stars pay tribute to Catherine O'Hara
items.description: The Canadian-born actress died at her home in Los Angeles "following a brief illness", according to a statement from her agency.

items.title: Laughing at Melania's ticket sales? You might be missing the point
items.description: Dire box office sales surrounding the US first lady's bio-doc have made headlines, but some argue there's likely a good reason Jeff Bezos's Amazon MGM Studios has splashed so much cash on MELANIA.

items.title: 3D-printed guns pose 'greatest risk' to community, expert warns
items.description: Hardware stores would report customers suspected of building 3D-printed guns to the authorities under fresh calls for corporate Australia to play a role in thwarting access to the deadly weapons

items.title: Rust-bucket graveyard offers new canvases for stories of desert survival
items.description: The artists of Mimili, in the APY Lands of South Australia, are using new methods to share crucial knowledge of Country and culture, including repurposed car parts.

items.title: Children living in makeshift tents in Gaza are dying from hypothermia
items.description: Mohammed died from hypothermia while in his mother's arms after a cold night in Gaza. His family are one of hundreds of thousands of Gazans enduring harsh winter conditions in flimsy tents across the enclave.

items.title: Resident in bushfire zone left in 'blind panic' after mobile connection failures
items.description: A resident in a bushfire zone says they were left in a "blind panic" after their mobile phone couldn't connect, as an advocate warns of more system failures if major changes aren't made.

items.title: The 'trap' threatening the national solar panel recycling scheme
items.description: Australia is on the brink of a solar panel waste crisis. Experts say there's much to do before a national recycling program can stand on its own two feet.

items.title: Relief on the horizon after record heatwave delivers 50C
items.description: For the eighth consecutive day Australia's south-east inland will bake in temperatures well above 40 degrees Celsius.

items.title: Five quick hits: 'Old man' Djokovic turns back time and cramping Carlos causes controversy
items.description: Gadecki and Peers make their own bit of history and "old man" Djokovic turns back the clock to reach his 11th Aussie final. Here are the quick hits from day 13 at the Australian Open.

items.title: Island to get childcare solution, too late for the Archers
items.description: After fighting for years for a childcare solution for her community, Teisha Archer says the news it will be happening is "wonderful" — but will come too late to help her and others in her situation.

items.title: Andrew Forrest has sunk $760m into these nickel mines. Will they ever reopen?
items.description: This week marks 60 years since one of Australia's biggest mineral discoveries put Kambalda on the map. But now all the WA town's nickel mines have closed and the prospect of a future restart is unclear.

items.title: This easy zucchini, corn and feta dish packs a punch
items.description: With tender roasted zucchini, salty feta, charred sweet corn and crunchy seeds, this dish will satisfy a veggie craving and is the perfect balance of taste and texture.

items.title: Could it be civilians found Celine, when the police could not?
items.description: Facing extreme weather and limited resources, Tasmania Police had to stop its search for Celine Cremer. But with her disappearance unresolved, loved ones turned to a private investigator instead.

items.title: It was an audacious idea to seize power, but would ACT voters have bought it?
items.description: The idea of a coalition between the ACT Greens and the Canberra Liberals appears to be on hold for now — but a quick history lesson is important to understand how both sides were willing to consider it.

items.title: In following his own theory, man finds human remains that could be Celine Cremer’s
items.description: Celine Cremer went missing in 2023 from a track in a remote part of Tasmania's north-west. With several recent discoveries in the area, these are the theories of what could have happened.

items.title: Man jailed for supplying illicit drugs to 'vulnerable' teens in state care
items.description: A man who introduced teenage sisters in state care to amphetamines was "well-aware" the drug was "dangerous, addictive and can destroy lives", a judge has said.

items.title: Farmers estimate $20m in livestock killed in Victorian fires
items.description: The fires wiped out swathes of farmland and killed tens of thousands of livestock.

items.title: This beach is a social media dream but a safety nightmare
items.description: As influencers draw crowds to a notorious drowning danger zone, surf lifesavers and researchers are thinking about how unpatrolled beaches can be managed in the age of social media.

items.title: 'Serious concerns' as Kakadu National Park airport slated for demolition
items.description: Kakadu's main airport, which services a wide and remote corner of the Northern Territory, has been slated for demolition as the deadline for the nearby uranium mine's rehabilitation looms.

items.title: Parental estrangement isn't new but social media makes it harder
items.description: Cutting ties with your parents isn't a new phenomenon but having it painstakingly documented across social media is a contemporary problem.
